posts.post_content: This card is pretty interesting... back when I started playing magic I saw this and I was like "riiiiiite, guy draws 3, big deal, gimme four". It's one of those cards you can only fully understand after playing a while, sort of like Necropotence.
posts.html:
This card is pretty interesting... back when I started playing magic I saw this and I was like "riiiiiite, guy draws 3, big deal, gimme four". It's one of those cards you can only fully understand after playing a while, sort of like Necropotence.
Report Abuse  
Posted By: LeoKula (4/5/2011 8:31:25 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Ofcourse, your opponent would have to be able to play those drawn cards for them to be worth anything- this guy loves counter decks, discard decks, and hand overload decks. Since his CMC is legit, a 4/4 flyer is well worth the "set-back" ability, which put in the appropriate deck, is hardly a set back.

Posted By: yesnomu (11/8/2010 3:59:27 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
These are the cornerstone of my pure-blue "big beastie conjuring" deck. Its drawback is obvious and, well, pretty serious. Three cards for each opponent is a lot, especially in early game.
  
   
But it's \*massive\*. It's 3 mana for a 4/4 flying. That means you can attack 'em for four on the fourth turn. Better yet, put an Unstable Mutation on it and you can attack 'em for SEVEN on the fourth turn. Put TWO Unstable Mutations on and, well, you get the idea.
  
   
Unless they blast it with one of the cards \*you\* let them draw ;)
posts.html:
These are the cornerstone of my pure-blue "big beastie conjuring" deck. Its drawback is obvious and, well, pretty serious. Three cards for each opponent is a lot, especially in early game.

But it's *massive*. It's 3 mana for a 4/4 flying. That means you can attack 'em for four on the fourth turn. Better yet, put an Unstable Mutation on it and you can attack 'em for SEVEN on the fourth turn. Put TWO Unstable Mutations on and, well, you get the idea.

Unless they blast it with one of the cards *you* let them draw ;)

posts.post_content:
Woah, just what I was looking for my [Iron Maiden](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Iron Maiden) & [Ebony Owl Netsuke](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Ebony Owl Netsuke) / [Unsummon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unsummon) deck AND it's usable in multiplayer aswell.   
  
Was thinking [Skywinder Drake](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Skywinder Drake), but this pretty much fits better, not the first thing to cast of course, but after an Iron Maiden, it's a good play.
